law.catch_line: Consent of a parent to an adoption under this Part III of this subtitle may include:...

section.section:
Consent of a parent to an adoption under this Part III of this subtitle may include:
a provision barring a petitioner from learning identifying information about the parent; and
a waiver of the right to notice of further proceedings under this Part III of this subtitle.
Consent to adoption entered into before a judge on the record shall include a waiver of the revocation period.

Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, a parent may revoke consent to adoption under this Part III of this subtitle at any time within the later of:
30 days after the parent signs the consent; or
30 days after the adoption petition is filed.
Consent to adoption under subsection (a)(2) of this section is irrevocable.

text.section: A local department may revoke consent to an adoption under this Part III of this subtitle at any time before a juvenile court enters an order of adoption under this Part III of this subtitle.
A child may revoke consent or object to an adoption under this Part III of this subtitle at any time before a juvenile court enters an order of adoption under this Part III of this subtitle.
